Name: Order of demonstrative, numeral, adjective and noun
Position of verbal/nonverbal adjectives and numerals
Description: Relationship between whether semantic adjectives are verbs and whether they occur closer to the noun than numerals when both occur on the same side of the noun (Table 3 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Verbal/nonverbal adjectives and demonstratives
Description: Relationship between whether semantic adjectives are verbs and whether they occur closer to the noun than demonstratives when both occur on the same side of the noun (Table 4 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Numeral classifiers and numeral-demonstrative order
Description: Relationship between whether a language has numeral classifiers and whether numerals occur closer to the noun than the demonstratives when both occur on the same side of the noun (Table 5 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Numeral classifiers and numeral-adjective order
Description: Relationship between whether a language has numeral classifiers and whether semantic adjectives occur closer to the noun than the numeral when both occur on the same side of the noun (Table 6 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Position of verbal vs. nonverbal adjectives
Description: Relationship between whether semantic adjectives are verbs and the order of adjective and noun (Table 7 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Numeral classifiers and numeral/demonstrative position
Description: Relationship between whether the language has numeral classifiers and whether numeral and demonstrative occur on the same side of the noun (Table 8 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Numeral classifiers and numeral/adjective position
Description: Relationship between whether the language has numeral classifiers and whether numeral and adjective occur on the same side of the noun (Table 9 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Position of adjectives and relative clauses
Description: Relationship between the order of semantic adjective and noun and the order of relative clause and noun in languages where semantic adjectives are not verbs (Table 10 in Dryer 2018)

Name: Adjusted frequencies
Description: Adjusted frequencies bearing on Greenbergâ€™s Universal 18, distinguishing languages where semantic adjectives are verbs and languages where they are not verbs (Table 13 in Dryer 2018)
